examples: Alan's explanation just muddies the issue!
The issue comes up over and over on the stump.
He danced the issue around.
I pressed the issue home to them.
The winter issue is hot off the press.
words.defineEn: an important matter about which people argue or talk
words.defineVi: một vấn đề quan trọng về mà mọi người tranh luận hoặc nói chuyện

examples: Lots of couples have problems in the first year of marriage.
The problem has now reached crisis point.
The problem was always at the back of my mind.
There are problems.
The problem is all in his head.
words.defineEn: something that causes difficulties and is hard to overcome
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó gây ra khó khăn và khó vượt qua

examples: The therapist told her patient that it was important to confess their mistakes and take responsibility for their actions because confession is good for the soul and can bring about personal growth.
But, the end of World War II brought about a big change to the air travel industry.
This regulation sometimes brought about some of the progressives’ goals.
But they also brought about the destruction of rural lands, divisions between social classes, and rapid urbanization.
And it brought about the disappearance of 75% of the world’s species.
words.defineVi: để gây ra một cái gì đó để xảy ra

examples: I never thought you would carry out your threat.
The company was struggling because there were too many chiefs and not enough Indians to carry out the work.
Very few carry out these threats and those that do not, lose some credibility with their children who see them as all mouth and no action.
The flu always comes with aches and pains, making it difficult to move around and carry out daily tasks.
She was tempted to call his bluff, hardly able to believe he’d carry out his threat.
And I came down with a really bad case of hypothermia.
You could come down with full-blown anaphylactic shock.
If the doctor then treats a new patient, that patient often comes down with the fever.
In 2015, a South Korean businessman came down with MERS, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, after returning from a business trip.
People who were infected would come down with a mild fever, a rash, maybe a headache, but that was it.

words.defineEn: to produce or create something, usually an idea, a solution, or a plan, through one's own efforts or thinking
words.defineVi: để sản xuất hoặc tạo ra một cái gì đó, thường là một ý tưởng, một giải pháp hoặc một kế hoạch, thông qua những nỗ lực hoặc suy nghĩ của chính mình

examples: Three villages have gone without water for days.
If you can't afford a new car, you'll just have to go without.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
After his breakup, Nicholas experienced a dry spell and went without any sexual encounters for several months.
I like to give the children what they want even if I have to go without.
words.defineEn: to continue without something that one usually has or needs
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục mà không có một cái gì đó mà người ta thường có hoặc cần

examples: I haven't lost my job yet, but the writing is on the wall: my company just laid off 50 more people today.
The government turned its back to the thousands of employees laid off during the financial crisis.
She had a great job with a supportive team, but eventually the company downsized and she was laid off.
The company was determined to increase profits by hook or by crook, even if it meant laying off some employees.
John was having a bad day when his car broke down, and then he found out he'd been laid off from work as well.
words.defineVi: ngừng thực hiện một hoạt động

examples: They put up a good fight, but they never really had a chance of defeating us.
She and her campaign put up a fight to the very end, but it was clear in the weeks leading up to the election that she would lose.
The investors who have put up around $30 million could catch a cold.
Why do they bother putting up a fight?
'Put up your hands!'
words.defineEn: to accept or tolerate an unpleasant situation, person, etc. without complaining
words.defineVi: chấp nhận hoặc chịu đựng một tình huống khó chịu, một người, v.v. mà không phàn nàn

words.defineEn: to finish all of something and not have anymore
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành tất cả của một cái gì đó và không có nữa

examples: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke.
At the same time as this cold spell, an extinction event wiped out many large vertebrates in the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia.
Back in the BCE era, entire ideas, religions, and political movements were wiped out.
In a team effort, the infection is wiped out.
Between 1347 and 1351, it wiped out 30% to 50% of the entire population of Europe.
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ hoàn toàn hoặc loại bỏ
